summary: To ensure that airport revenue (e.g., concessions, parking fees) went toward improving airports, a 1982 federal law prohibited that revenue from being diverted to non-airport uses. But currently, 5 city or state governments and 4 transportation authorities are grandfathered in—exempt from the restriction due to local revenue use arrangements predating the federal law. title: Airport Funding: Information on Grandfathered Revenue Diversion and Potential Implications of Repeal
